resources.string: First Aid Quiz
You’re having lunch with a friend and he begins to choke on some food. He can’t speak, breathe or cough it up. How can you help?
Put your fingers down his throat to try to dislodge the obstruction
Do the Heimlich manoeuvre on him
Give up to five back blows between his shoulder blades
Your colleague is complaining of breathlessness and a tight pain in the chest. You suspect a heart attack. What should you do?
Get him to lay down flat
Encourage him to stand up and move around slowly
Sit him in a comfortable position
One of your friends has cut his arm and is bleeding severely. How do you treat his injury?
Put the injured limb in some cold water
Apply direct pressure over the wound
Give him an aspirin
You’re walking home and you see a man lying on the ground. You ask him if he’s all right but he doesn’t respond. What should you do next?
Leave him to wake up by himself
Begin CPR
Check his airway is clear
You need to perform CPR on your neighbour after she collapsed and stopped breathing. How many chest compressions to rescue breaths should you do?
30 compressions to two breaths
20 compressions to five breaths
15 compressions to three breaths
Your friend has a severe allergy and carries an auto-injector. Choose the true statement.
Anyone can help your friend to use their auto-injector during a severe allergic reaction
Only your friend can use their auto-injector during a severe allergic reaction
You must have specific training to help your friend use their auto-injector during a severe allergic reaction
If someone is unresponsive and breathing, what is the key action you can take to help them?
Move them onto their front and tilt their head to the side
Move them onto their back and tilt their head back
Move them onto their side and tilt their head back
If someone has a burn, what is the key action you can take to help?
Cover the burn
Cool the burn
Clean the burn
If a person with hypothermia has wet clothes on, what should you do?
Remove all their wet clothes and wrap them in whatever else is available
Remove some of their wet clothes and give them some of your clothes
Leave them in their wet clothes and wrap them in a blanket or other clothing
Your friend is having a seizure and an ambulance is on the way. What can you do to help them?
Help them take their medication
Leave them alone and give them privacy
Make them safe and prevent injury
If someone has a broken bone, which of the following statements is true?
If you do not support the limb, it doesn’t matter. The bone will just naturally heal on its own
If you do not support the limb, the person will be able to move the limb more easily and reduce the pain
If you do not support the limb it may cause further injury and pain
